p: Under abiotic stress caused by pollutions the activity and gene expression of antioxidative enzymes or the key enzymes of biosynthetic pathways of non-enzymatic antioxidants can be regulated via signaling molecules such as phytohormones, reactive oxygen species (ROS) and nitric oxide [ 16]. According to the published papers, the data on activation or inactivation of a certain signaling pathway and molecules (mitogen-activated protein kinases (MAPKs), phosphatase, calcium (Ca 2+)) in plants in conditions of oil-polluted soil have been insufficient so far. Conducting further studies will contribute to more detailed understanding of molecular mechanisms of the response and possible adaptation of plants to the crude oil-polluted soil.
